{{BLP sources|date=October 2016}} {{Infobox comedian <!-- for individuals - see Template:Infobox comedian for usage --> | name = Wendy Liebman | image = Wendy Liebman.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Wendy Liebman performing at the Stress Factory in New Brunswick, 2012 | pseudonym = | birth_name = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | birth_date = {{bda|1961|2|27}} | birth_place = [[Manhasset, New York]], United States | death_date = | death_place = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | medium = Stand-up comedy, television | nationality = American | education = | alma_mater = | active = | residence = United States | employer = | genre = [[Observational comedy]] | subject = [[Culture of the United States|American culture]], everyday life | spouse = | domesticpartner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | notable_work = | memorials = | signature = | website = http://www.wendyliebman.com/ | footnotes = | module = }}
'''Wendy Liebman''' (born February 27, 1961 in [[Manhasset, New York]]) is an American [[stand-up comedian]]. Her standup style involves the use of gently paced, subtle wordplay. <ref name=SFEXmainer>Katz, Leslie (December 22, 2015). [http://www.sfexaminer.com/three-timer-wendy-liebman-savors-her-s-f-kosher-comedy/ "Three-timer Wendy Liebman savors her S.F. kosher comedy"]. ''[[The San Francisco Examiner]]''.</ref>
==Early life== Liebman grew up in [[Roslyn, Long Island, New York]], where she lived in a house at 110 Crescent Lane. Her earliest performances involved her, her sister, and a neighborhood friend performing the play ''[[Rumpelstilskin]]'' in their basement.<ref>[http://www.jewishboston.com/events/13146-women-in-comedy-festival-presents-wendy-liebman "Women in Comedy Festival presents Wendy Liebman"]. JewishBoston.com. Combined Jewish Philanthropies. Retrieved December 23, 2015.</ref>
In 1983, Liebman graduated from [[Wellesley College]] with a bachelor's degree in psychology.<ref>{{cite news |first=Bill |last=DeYoung |coauthors= |title=Comic Liebman is 'amused, bemused' by life |work=Stuart News |page=E16 |date= 2005-01-07 |accessdate=2 January 2010|quote= |url= }}</ref> Shortly after graduating from college, Liebman performed psychology research at [[Harvard Medical School]].{{Clarify|date=January 2010}}<ref>{{cite news |first=Dean |last=Johnson |coauthors= |title=Comedy; Wedding bells ring up new jokes for Liebman |work=[[Boston Herald]] |page=S16 |date= 2003-02-14 |accessdate=2010-01-02|quote= |url= }}</ref>
==Career== In 1984, after taking a class at the [[Cambridge Center for Adult Education]], Liebman began performing stand-up comedy in the [[Boston]] area.<ref name="breaking">{{cite news |last=Schorr |first=Melissa |url= http://articles.boston.com/2012-03-18/magazine/31199940_1_funny-women-phyllis-diller-women-in-comedy-festival |title=Wendy Liebman recalls breaking into Boston’s stand-up scene |work=[[Boston Globe]] |date=2012-03-18 |accessdate=2012-03-26}}</ref>
In 1996, Liebman won the [[American Comedy Award]] for Female Stand-up Comedian of the Year.<ref>Virtel, Louis (July 23, 2014). [http://www.hitfix.com/comedy/comic-star-wendy-liebman-auditions-on-americas-got-talent "Comic Star Wendy Liebman Auditions on 'America's Got Talent'"]. HitFlix.</ref>
Liebman has appeared on [[The Larry Sanders Show]] on [[HBO]], [[The Tonight Show]], ''[[Dr. Katz, Professional Therapist|Dr. Katz - Professional Therapist]]'', ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]'', ''[[Late Show with David Letterman]]'', ''[[Late Night with Jimmy Fallon]]'' and ''[[The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]''.
In November 2011, her [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] special, ''Wendy Liebman: Taller On TV'' debuted.<ref>https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1928320/?ref_=ttrel_rel_tt</ref> In May 2012, it was posted on her website as a $5 DRM-free download, then in 2014 it was released as an audio download.
Liebman is the daughter-in-law of the late [[Robert B. Sherman]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Wendy Liebman|website=Traffic.libsyn.com|url=http://traffic.libsyn.com/acomicstale/Vinnie_Brand_with_Special_Guest_Wendy_Liebman.mp3}}</ref>
In 2014, Liebman and her husband were driving when they were struck by a drunk driver. The accident resulted in damage to seven cars and one fatality. The incident affected Liebman's standup career, and so the following year, to “get back out there in a big way” Liebman decided to be a contestant on season nine of ''[[America's Got Talent]]''.<ref name=SFEXmainer/> August 13, 2014, she was eliminated in the quarter-finals, but on August 15, 2014, judge [[Howard Stern]] picked Liebman as his wild card for the season, bringing her to the semi-finals. She was eliminated once more on the September 3 episode.
==Personal life== Liebman is Jewish. Although she did not grow up with a strong Jewish identity, she developed a greater connection to her Judaism after reading ''The Complete Idiot's Guide to Jewish History and Culture.''<ref name=SFEXmainer/>
On April 12, 2003, Liebman married TV producer and writer Jeffrey Sherman, whose father and uncle (the [[Sherman Brothers]]) wrote film music for [[Walt Disney]] in the 1960s.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jacqueline |last=Savaiano |coauthors= |title=WEDDINGS/CELEBRATIONS: VOWS; Wendy Liebman and Jeffrey Sherman |work=[[The New York Times]]|page=13 |date=2003-04-20 |accessdate=2010-01-02 |quote= |url= }}</ref> Sherman has two sons from a previous marriage.<ref>{{cite news |first=Dean |last=Johnson |coauthors= |title=Crazy love; Boston comic Wendy Liebman has been on both sides of Valentine's Day divide |work=[[Boston Herald]] |page=025 |date= February 12, 2005}}</ref>
In December 2015 Liebman moved from her rented home in [[Studio City]] into a house in the [[West Hills, Los Angeles|West Hills neighborhood]] of Los Angeles.<ref name=SFEXmainer/>
==Discography== ===Album=== * ''Taller on TV'' 2014 Download ([[Image Entertainment]])
==Filmography== ===Shorts=== * ''[[Filmmakers Alliance|The Remote]]'' (2000) directed by Frank Chindamo * ''50 Greatest'' (2011) (spoof of [[VH1]] countdown shows)
===Stand-up Specials=== Writer, Performer * ''Girls' Night Out'' 1994 * ''[[HBO|Women of the Night IV]]'' 1995 * ''[[Comic Relief USA|Comic Relief VII]]'' 1995 * ''[[HBO Comedy Half-Hour]]'' 1996 * ''[[VH1|Stand-Up Spotlight]]'' 2002 * ''[[Showtime (TV network)|Green Collar Comedy Show]]'' 2010 * ''Wendy Liebman: Taller on TV'' 2011 (also director)
